title: Purpose and Vision
description: Defining your purpose and vision clarifies the compelling reason for undertaking this initiative and provides a shared focus for the work that follows. Having a clear pupose and vision is necessary for alignment between all initiative components.

responses.question: What is our compelling reason to undertake this initiative?
subquestions: What are the most significant issues to address?
Who are the students most in need?
What data, research, and evidence can we use to identify our focus?

responses.question: What will be the ultimate impact?
Which stakeholders need to be included in defining the initiative's purpose and vision?
What visioning work have we done in the past? What documents do we already have that can be useful to this work?

resources.title: The Hexagon: An Exploration Tool Hexagon Discussion & Analysis Tool Instructions
resources.description: Evaluate the fit and feasibility of implementing programs or practices in a given context; Most commonly used in exploration stage; Includes tool, guidance and instructions for team use, and guiding questions

resources.title: Management and Operations of Online Programs
resources.description: P. 24  "Online learning: The opportunities it can provide; the problems it can solve" provides one page list of possible drivers and rating scale for prioritization of drivers

resources.title: The Shifting Paradigm of Teaching: Personalized Learning According to Teachers
resources.description: P. 24  "Online learning: The opportunities it can provide; the problems it can solve" provides one page list of possible drivers and rating scale for prioritization of drivers

resources.title: Six Tips for Engaging Your Community in the Visioning Process

responses.question: Drivers:
subquestions: What critical conversations and data can help identify initiative drivers?
What current issues need to be solved?
What is the level of priority for each driver we've identified?

responses.question: Goals:
subquestions: What do we plan to achieve?
What will be the guiding principles for the initiative?

responses.question: Benefits of taking action:
subquestions: How will this improve our district?
What other benefits will result from this initiative?

responses.question: Risks of not taking action:
subquestions: What if no action is taken?
What opportunities might be missed without this initiative?

responses.question: Impacts:
subquestions: Who will be impacted, and how?
What is the impact for the district?

responses.question: Capacity:
subquestions: Will we need to shift priorities/resources to make time to plan and implement this initiative?

resources.title: Levers and Logic Models: A Framework to Guide Research and Design of High-Quality Competency-Based Education Systems

title: Logistics & Alignment
description: Ensuring the logistics align with the vision and purpose will support the success of the initiative.

responses.question: How will specific budget needs be identified?
What outside funding will be necessary?
What priorities will guide our budgeting decisions?
What human resources funding will be included in the budget?
What is the timeline for planning, developing, and implementing the initiative?
What milestones and deliverables are included in the initiative timeline?
What is the process for recruiting students?
Is there a student population focus (e.g. credit recovery, honors, open enrollment)?
How will enrollment and scheduling be managed in the SIS?
How will student readiness be assessed and what supports will be in place for identified challenges?

title: Learning Model Redesign
description: Personalized, competency-based learning in a blended learning environment

responses.question: What is the structure of the learning environment? (Time and place; remote/hybrid/blended)
What grade level(s) will be served?
Who is the project manager for this intiative? (if applicable)
What courses will be offered and how is that determination made?
What is the initial scope of initiative (i.e. pilot or district wide)?
How will this learning model impact teacher and student roles? Considerations may include course pace, schedule for students and/or teachers, standards-based grading, etc.

resources.title: PLANNING FOR QUALITY: A Guide for Starting and Growing a Digital Learning Program
resources.description: Digital Learning Collaborative resource; Planning guide addressing: goals, planning and implmentation to meet those goals, and fostering culture change; Includes graphic organizer to support strategic planning efforts. Questions to ask and decisions to make related to four focus areas: content, teaching, technology, and operations

resources.title: The Annual Report of the Digital Learning Collaborative: Snapshot 2020 - A review of K-12 online, blended, and digital learning
resources.description: Digital Learning Collaborative report; Includes visual for the spectrum of defining dimensions of an online program- p.4 (e.g. comprehensiveness, reach, type, delivery); Includes sections for various structures of online/blended learning environments; Each section includes related info; Definition, level of engagement, time and space, student demographics, and case studies

responses.question: How will student support services be provided?
How will social and emotional learning be addressed?
How will special populations be served (e.g. AIG, EC, EL)?

resources.title: MENTOR FUNDAMENTALS A GUIDE TO MENTORING ONLINE LEARNERS

title: Sustainability
description: In order to ensure competency-based, personalized learning not only continues, but continues to improve, teams will need to focus on program reviews aligned with a continuous improvement cycle.

responses.question: What framework(s) will we use for reflection and evaluation?  How will we measure, analyze, review, and improve implementation?
What stakeholders will be involved in the evaluation process and how will they be involved?
How often will we reflect and evaluate aspects of this initiative?
How will we ensure the quality and availability of needed data for staff, students, and the community?
What student learning data is available to determine the level of impact of implementation?
How will we measure and align efforts to ensure equity?
What surveys are available to measure student and teacher levels of engagement as new instructional models are implemented?
What will inform your professional learning offerings?
How are we measuring the impact of professional learning on classroom practices?
In what ways will you engage with thought partners and organizations to continue learning and growing?
What process is in place to act on what we learn as part of our reflection and evaluation process?
What will be the initiative budget and related expenditures (e.g. funding for infrastructure, devices, content, professional development, human resources)?
What district policies need to be revised or need to be developed? (e.g. attendance/seat time, grading, etc.)
What common knowledge and understanding will be critical to inform policy decisions?
